meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>person</kanji> <kanji>wolf </kanji> is a <vocabulary>werewolf</vocabulary>. This word is less common than 狼男, but it's used more and more thanks to the card game of the same name!
readingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You haven't learned the on'yomi for 狼 (wolf) yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you remember that, as well as which on'yomi to use for 人:

There's a <vocabulary>werewolf</vocabulary> in front of you wearing  <reading>jean</reading>s and eating <reading>roe</reading> (じんろう). This is typical behavior for werewolves, as I'm sure you know.
